title: David, Dwarshuis rested, Forde replaces Motie, Australia bowl first again

html:
Current RR: 10.50

 • Last 5 ov (RR): 50/3 (10.00)

Live Forecast:WI 211

Report

Hardie and Bartlett come into the XI as Australia rest David for precautionary reasons after his stunning century on Friday

Australia won the toss and elected to bowl against West Indies

Australia have rested star batter Tim David and left-arm seamer Ben Dwarshuis and will bowl first in the fourth T20I against West Indies in Basseterre after Mitchell Marsh won the toss for the fourth straight time in the series.

Allrounder Aaron Hardie will replace David and is listed to bat at No. 7 with Cooper Connolly elevated to bat at No. 6. Xavier Bartlett also comes in for his first game of the series and will likely take the new ball with Dwarshuis given a rest.

The resting of both players is precautionary because of the back-to-back games given David is coming back from a serious hamstring injury and his stunning 102 not out from 37 balls on Friday night was his first innings back since then.

CA confirmed David's hamstring is fine despite him not playing. Dwarshuis has had back issues in the past and has become an important part of Australia's attack in the absence of the big three.

Bartlett gets an opportunity after an excellent MLC season having been a late call-up to the squad when Josh Hazlewood was rested.

West Indies have made one tactical change with seamer Matthew Forde replacing left-arm spinner Gudakesh Motie after he gave up 38 runs in two overs on Friday.

West Indies: 1 Brandon King, 2 Shai Hope (capt & wk), 3 Roston Chase, 4 Shimron Hetmyer, 5 Rovman Powell, 6 Sherfane Rutherford, 7 Jason Holder, 8 Matthew Forde, 9 Akeal Hosein, 10 Romario Shepherd, 11 Jediah Blades

Australia: 1 Mitchell Marsh (capt), 2 Glenn Maxwell, 3 Josh Inglis (wk), 4 Cameron Green, 5 Mitchell Owen, 6 Cooper Connolly, 7 Aaron Hardie, 8 Xavier Bartlett, 9 Sean Abbott, 10 Nathan Ellis, 11 Adam Zampa

Alex Malcolm is an associate editor at ESPNcricinfo
